name: Super Bowl LI Quiz | Super Bowl 2010s | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Patriots.

	Atlanta won the coin toss. Former U.S. President George H.W. Bush performed the coin toss. The Falcons dominated most of the game with a 21-3 score at the half, and a 25 point lead in the third quarter. The Patriots came back from the largest deficit in history to tie the game at 28 and force the first overtime in Super Bowl history. The Patriots won the overtime coin toss and elected to receive the kickoff.  James White scored on a 2-yard run to win 34-28. The OT score was the first time the PAtriots led in the game.

questions.text: Which quarterback started his seventh Super Bowl?
questions.explanation:
Tom Brady.

	Coming into the game Brady had a 4-2 record in the Super Bowl. Before making his seventh start he already had most of the career passing records for the biggest game of the NFL season.  Brady had previously been tied with Mike Lodish for most career Super Bowl games played. Ryan was named the 2016 MVP the day before the Super Bowl.

questions.text: What was the result of the first drive?
questions.explanation:
Patriots punt.

	Deion Jones, a rookie linebacker stopped a run on third down and a yard to go to force the Patriots punt. First down was an incomplete pass and second down was a pass from Tom Brady to Julian Edelman. Devonta Freeman had a 37-yard run on the Falcons first play. Atlanta also had to punt to end their first drive.

questions.text: Which team forced the first turnover?
questions.explanation:
Atlanta & Falcons & Atlanta Falcons.

	On his first carry in the second quarter, LeGarrette Blunt had the ball stripped from him by rookie linebacker Deion Jones. It was the first fumble since week two of the regular season for Blunt.

questions.text: Who scored the first points of the game?
questions.explanation:
Devonta Freeman, Falcons.

	With 12:15 remaining in the second quarter, the Falcons capitalized on the Patriots turnover when Devonta Freeman ran in from 5 yards out. After the kick they were up 7-0.  Austin Hooper caught a 19-yard touchdown catch with 8:48 to play in the half. The conversion kick made it 14-0 Atlanta.

questions.text: Which Atlanta defensive player returned an interception for a first half touchdown?
questions.explanation:
Robert Alford.

	The pick-6 made the score 21-0 Atlanta with 2:21 to play in the half. Alford had just two interceptions in the entire regular season.

questions.text: Who scored the first points of the second half?
questions.explanation:
Tevin Coleman, Falcons.

	Atlanta and New England both went three and out on their first drives of the half. Atlanta then drove down the field and scored to make it 28-3 with 8:31 remaining in the third quarter. Tevin Coleman caught the six yard pass from Matt Ryan.

questions.text: Tom Brady tossed a touchdown pass with 5:56 to play in the game. Who caught it?
questions.explanation:
Danny Amendola.

	The six yard touchdown catch brought the score to 28-20 after the 2-point conversion. White converted the try on a direct snap from the center.

questions.text: Which player caught a miraculous pass with about 2 minutes to play?
questions.explanation:
Julian Edelman.

	Edelman caught the pass after it was deflected into the air. He grabbed it, let it slip, and it bounced off a defender's leg before he grabbed it again. A few plays later the Patriots finished the drive, scored the 2-point conversion and tied the game at 28 with 57 seconds remaining.  James White scored the touchdown that brought them within two, while Amendola scored the tying conversion. The Falcons had lead by 25 points in the third quarter.

questions.text: Who won the game MVP award?
questions.explanation:
Tom Brady.

	Matt Ryan likely would have won it, had it not been for the huge comeback by the Patriots in the fourth quarter and overtime to win. Brady ended up setting the record for most (466) passing yards in a single Super Bowl, and in doing so won his fifth Lombardi Trophy, and the fourth time he was named MVP of the game.
